column4: hi, I have upgraded from kubuntu 9.10 to 10.04 on my desktop PC
but after upgradation Hibernation is not working
I tried to use "uswsusp", but it is for laptops..moreover on my PC crashes quite frequently after installing it. Is their any alternative ?
Please help, its very difficult to do without hibernation
Is there any solution to hibernation problem in ubuntu 10.04 ?
gather a bunch of info about your computer and post on the forums about it
tried in ubuntuforums, but no response their.
I have 1.24 GB RAM, 1GB swap space, 80GB HDD, P4 ? Hibernation worked in 9.10 but not in 10.04
uhm you could try shrinking your partition, then installing to another partition to see if the issue is upgrade-related
you mean using gparted and then reinstall ?
you can grow your main partition after. make sure you know how to reinstall grub though
but it worked with 9.10 and problem aroused the moment I upgraded to 10.04. So isn't update the problem ?
the problem may be not due to the upgrade tho, it may just be part of 10.04
